nodes.title:
In Opinion

Reforming Australiaâ€™s gun laws was possible thanks largely to â€œthe shared norm of bipartisanship and the willingness of conservatives, acting on principle, to risk alienating their base,â€ says Aaron Timms, a writer from Sydney, in a guest essay.https://t.co/4iWjnZzQOf

nodes.title: Russia earned what is very likely a record 93 billion euros in revenue from exports of oil, gas and coal in the first 100 days of the countryâ€™s invasion of Ukraine. The revenue exceeds what Russia is spending on the war. https://t.co/bNJuqRRsmf

nodes.title: Fox News is broadcasting the second day of the House committee hearing on the Jan. 6 attack after not carrying the first day. The network's hosts told their audience that the committee hearing last week was nothing more than "propaganda." https://t.co/hOV3ctrd0z

nodes.title: Andrew Giuliani said he will not be able to attend the first Republican debate in the New York City governorâ€™s race unless he sends proof of his Covid vaccination status, which he will not do. He says he is unvaccinated and has "natural immunity." https://t.co/HxNwYP2h5E

nodes.title:

https://t.co/AINQkL4jNj

nodes.title:
Google placed an engineer on paid leave after dismissing his claim that its AI is sentient.

The company said its systems imitated conversational exchanges but did not have consciousness. https://t.co/zDUdQENPhs https://t.co/yAingzDnQV

nodes.title:
Jennifer Hudson became an EGOT at the #TonyAwards on Sunday. ğŸ†

nodes.title:
For 20 years, the U.S. military tightly controlled what the world saw of GuantÃ¡namo Bay detainees. Few explicit images of prisoners became public. Until now.

nodes.title:

A year ago, gas sold for $3.08. https://t.co/fUY7k4OYA8

nodes.title: Breaking News: Senators struck a bipartisan deal on a narrow set of gun safety measures, bringing them closer to ending a yearslong congressional impasse. https://t.co/ecWuK8VSkN

nodes.title: The House Jan. 6 committee plans to use the testimony of Donald Trump's own campaign manager, Bill Stepien, against the former president on Monday, as it lays out evidence that Trump knowingly spread the lie that the 2020 election was stolen. https://t.co/JH6gAv2PIU
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil is trailing in polls for the countryâ€™s presidential race. He said that if he loses, it will most likely be thanks to a stolen vote.

Now he has enlisted a new ally in his fight against the electoral process: the military. https://t.co/lta4NLNiV8
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Of the 10 Republican senators supporting a bipartisan deal on gun safety, four are leaving Congress at the end of the year and five are not up for re-election for another four years. Only Mitt Romney of Utah will face voters in 2024. https://t.co/ERcK7TwGwY https://t.co/q3YKb1MZlx
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: On the 108th day of Vladimir Putinâ€™s unprovoked war on Ukraine, Russia appeared no closer to victory. But its forces did appear to be making slow, methodical and bloody progress toward control of eastern Ukraine. https://t.co/Z3WbcC5WxH

Itâ€™s soft. Itâ€™s vegan. Itâ€™s made from fossil fuels.

nodes.title: A Senate gun safety plan endorsed by 10 Republicans and 10 Democrats falls far short of reforms long championed by gun control activists and a majority of congressional Democrats. It amounts to notable, albeit narrow, progress amid deep party divisions. https://t.co/WEFNp05vCL https://t.co/KNCaulTD1s

"This is a renaissance."

The nation's HBCUs are experiencing a boom in enrollment, as they're embraced by a generation shaped by the first Black president, Black Lives Matter and shifting views on what constitutes the pinnacle of higher education. https://t.co/t3mqgCDiVJ https://t.co/72A7lV24cF

nodes.title: Breaking News: Ryan Kelley, a Republican running for governor in Michigan who was at the Capitol during the Jan. 6 attack, was arrested Thursday. He's the first person running in a major state or federal race to be charged in connection with the assault. https://t.co/OCUiy2aZq0

nodes.title: The Olympic gymnasts Simone Biles and McKayla Maroney are among more than 90 women suing the FBI for its failure to investigate Larry Nassar when it received credible information that he sexually abused girls. They are seeking over $1 billion in damages. https://t.co/vEs4p1IaX8
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The House on Wednesday voted to bar the sale of semiautomatic weapons to people under the age of 21 and ban the sale of large-capacity magazines, as parents of victims and survivors of mass shootings made appeals for Congress to act on gun violence. https://t.co/HdwZSMChin https://t.co/NyjWkubpbY

nodes.title: Twitter plans to give Elon Musk access to a large swath of its data, potentially down to its very last tweet, after he threatened to pull out of a $44 billion deal for the company, saying it has refused to give him information about fake accounts. https://t.co/XMKUDwtswh
